data.text: A good name is better than good oil;
It is better to go to the house of mourning,
Sorrow is better than laughter:
The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning;
It is better to hear a reproof of a wise man,
As the sound of thorns under a caldron,
For oppression makes a wise man mad,
The end of a matter is better than the beginning thereof:
Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry:
Say not, What has happened,
Wisdom is good with an inheritance:
For wisdom in its shadow is as the shadow of silver:
Behold the works of God:
In the day of prosperity live joyfully,
I have seen all things in the days of my vanity:
Be not very just;
Be not very wicked; and be not stubborn:
It is well for thee to hold fast by this;
Wisdom will help the wise man
For there is not a righteous man in the earth,
Also take no heed
For many times he shall trespass against thee,
All these things have I proved in wisdom:
That which is far beyond what was,
I and my heart went round about to know,
And I find her to be, and I will pronounce to be
Behold, this have I found, said the Preacher,
Which my soul sought after, but I found not:
But, behold, this have I found,
